SEARCH
Package librarySE.core

Class AbstractLibraryItem

java.lang.Object
librarySE.core.AbstractLibraryItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Borrowable, LibraryItem, Searchable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book, CD, Journal
public abstract class AbstractLibraryItem extends Object implements LibraryItem, Serializable
Abstract base implementation of LibraryItem that provides:
  • A generated unique UUID identifier for each item instance.
  • Common price handling with validation.
  • Thread-safe implementations of borrowing and returning operations.
  • A template-method based design that delegates copy-specific logic to subclasses via isAvailableInternal(), doBorrow(), and doReturn().

Concrete materials such as Book, CD, and Journal extend this class and only implement their own metadata and copy-tracking logic. All concurrency concerns and core behaviors are centralized here.

Concurrency Model

This class uses an internal ReentrantLock to guarantee that calls to borrow(), returnItem(), and isAvailable() are mutually exclusive per instance. This is important when multiple threads may attempt to borrow or return the same item concurrently.

The lock field is marked as transient so that it is not included in JSON persistence when using Gson. Because Gson does not invoke constructors or field initializers during deserialization, the lock is lazily initialized via getLock() to avoid NullPointerException after loading items from disk.

Template Methods

  • isAvailable() acquires the lock and then delegates to isAvailableInternal().
  • borrow() acquires the lock, checks availability via isAvailableInternal(), and if allowed, calls doBorrow().
  • returnItem() acquires the lock and calls doReturn().

Subclasses are responsible only for implementing the internal methods that adjust their copy counters; they do not need to worry about synchronization or template flow.

Author:
eman
